title: I understand baron was probably doing too much damage before this patch but
body:
Now he does literally 0 damage wtf, you guys like more than halved its damage, there is literally no risk in doing baron anymore and getting turned halfway because both its damage and debuff got heavily nerfed.

Revert the change and reduce its damage by like 10~20% instead, dont nerf the debuff at all because thats the thing that makes baron a risk.

replies.body: I really liked the baron, he felt powerfull after years.
I felt the same.  Finally, he's a threat.  Like Vilemaw. Lol.  Alas, now he is (semi)tanky noodle.
Baron did too much dmg? Really?

Well considering the change of halving it's damage, Riot seems to think so.  I think the vast majority of the player-base thought it finally became a riskier objective again so you actually needed the whole team unless extremely ahead.

>

well i mean, thats the point. the buff it gives is literally a game ending buff, it should be a risky objective... if riot thinks baron did too much damage then they a re just flat out wrong. of ALL the things that deals "too much damage" in this game baron isnt one of them. an objective that has a buff that strong shouldn't be as weak as a blue buff with a more massive HP pool.

the real reason it was nerfed is because they want champs like {{champion:77}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:24}}  {{champion:19}} to solo it again.

> [{quoted}](name=ChristmasEvelynn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kT6JftXJ,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2018-06-01T15:18:58.590+0000)
>
> well i mean, thats the point. the buff it gives is literally a game ending buff, it should be a risky objective... 
> 

This. People can argue how ever they want to, but the point remains...Baron was a high risk/high reward objective that changed to a low risk/high reward objective.  I play champs like bard, lulu, janna, others who should absolutely love the baron nerf, but it just seems to be too much.

Considering how Baron's pre-nerf damage was one of the few changes that earned _praise_ from most of the playerbase, including on the Boards, it's perplexing that it would get changed, especially so soon. It feels like Riot is having trouble determining whether Baron needs to be a raid boss, or just a vessel for a game-ending bonus, and while most players at large prefer the former, it feels like the devs would rather have the latter for competitive reasons.

Baron was punishing players who started Baron instead of punishing the team that is letting the opposition take baron. This is unequivocally wrong and rewards being a coward instead of bravery. 

The change makes sense, the brave team shouldn't get annihilated by Baron and the coward team come into pick up the pieces because Baron has done most of the work.
If your starting Baron when over half of the enemy team is alive (specifically the jungler) you are making a bad play and should be punished.
If that principle was true then Baron would hardly ever be taken. That is not a good thing either.

It would be fine if people could take it earlier with less of a risk, assuming that the benifits of taking were not stupidly high. It's an interactive buff to your minions. (ya sure it has other buffs also) but the most important aspect is that you just walk up with your wave and poke at towers and actively avoid fighting. (because fighting comes with the risk of losing, and losing Baron buffs.)

Elder dragon is way more healthy for the game BECAUSE your benifits of it require you to fight. Or posture in such a way that fighting is in your favor.

I'm fine with it being a vessel if the buff wasn't so damned strong. The reason the change was good was because getting a literal game ending buff required work and risk. Instead of sneezing in the wrong direction and suddenly having it.

At least with elder dragon you are forced to fight to make use of the buff. Baron is just fucking there.
How long did the Raid Boss Baron last? 2 patches? He had a good run.

It was more of a dungeon boss. You only needed 5 people to kill it.

######I know what "Raid Boss" means in the context of LoL.
People were finally happy with Baron. Again they don't listen to the players.

Because 80% of the boards are just stupid. They want blatantly too strong champions to remain unnerfed (or even buffed) for the *sole* reason that they're "only broken in pro-play", they want cancerous as fuck champions buffed even *more*, and they want *already* sub-50 champions nerfed even more.

And *far* too many of them want a fighter meta, which almost literally nobody but fighter mains enjoy.

I mean, if you just *listened* to the playerbase, they'd have Taliyah have a 60%+ winrate in proplay, Shaco would be buffed even *more* past the 55% he has at all tiers, every ADC would have a sub-45 winrate...
*Cough* {{champion:39}}  *cough*

Literally the only thing we have ever asked for tailyah is her old w back, we have never asked for a buff since she had her worked ground duration lowered.

Most of those things you listed as straight up wrong, only shaco players want him buffed, I have seen nothing asking for a fighter meta hell I saw a post on the front page saying tank metas are the best, you're insane if you think boards want any thing with more then a 49% buffed they start calling for nerfs at that point, fucking sorry that we don't want our perfectly fine champions getting nerfed because the best players in the game used them.

The problem is with people like you acting like an elitist and thinking you know the game better then anyone that disagrees with you. In reality you are part of the percentage of idiots on the boards

It seems Riot's finally given up on trying to actually balance the game.

Now all that matters is squishing out the final pennies from the Asian market before the game dies out.

I'm sorry but that's no where near true. Baron was extremely overturned and got nerfed... I fail to see the issue with it. It was literally shredding whole teams, and that should never be the case. Teamfights are supposed to shred your teams, not mid - late game neutral objectives. he still does a ton of damage and isn't as easy to kill as he used to be.

Baron used to shred teams in the past and it was considered a healthy objective.  The damage he dealt seemed on par with OLD baron, which I liked.  It made contesting a poorly called baron by the enemy a good option even if you couldn't take baron after killing the enemy team.
This, precis. There was no reason to nerf baron aside from increasing one team's (the leading one) snowball potential.
So instead of, y'know, just reverting the damage buffs and keeping the health buffs, they had to rip the balls off his damage. Makes sense.

Again someone points asian markets and Tencent and gets downvoted, you are not even wrong, this along with turret nerfs are changes made so that the games are just shorter i'll put it in simpler terms,  koreans and chinese like short games because of internet cafes and yada yada, Tencent are chinese, Tencent owns LoL, Chinese companies give two shits about western audiences, put two and two.
Looks like it is back to playing udyr and soloing baron when it spawns.

in 3 patches scuttle will do more damage than baron
They made it more tanky, and in turn took away the damage. I like they made it more tanky, but for how strong it is, it needs to be doing a lot more damage.
They.  Don't.  Know.  How. To. Balance.  The. Game.  Anymore.

This irritates me in two ways. One, Baron was finally in a similar spot to season 5-6. A objective that provides a buff and is usually only taken when one team dies, or if it's end game and teams are trying to make plays. So much better than it just being another stepping stone that only worsened the snowball meta as it was akin to a red buff, but did more. Baron needed this and I think it's bs that they changed it back. 

Second,  
BARON ATTACK SPEED 0.75 ⇒ 0.625
BASE CORRUPTION DAMAGE 120 ⇒ 60
CORRUPTION DAMAGE RATIO 0.3 total attack damage ⇒ 0.2 total attack damage  
What the hell? You halved the base damage, lowered attack speed by a good portion, and lowered the corruption damage as a sprinkle on the top. There is such thing as moderation, but the balance team seems to lack any of it. When you're trying to use a triple beam balance, you ease you're way to the perfect balance, not flip the weights from side to side till you hit the mark. Patch notes should be closer between with less big changes. Instead of dropping a huge patch and scrambling to fix the issues that arose from that one.
What when did they half his damage?

BARON ATTACK SPEED 0.75 ⇒ 0.625
BASE CORRUPTION DAMAGE 120 ⇒ 60
CORRUPTION DAMAGE RATIO 0.3 total attack damage ⇒ 0.2 total attack damage
SPECIAL ATTACKS No longer apply corruption stacks

This means they halved his on-hit damage and basically halved his armor/mr shred.

They didn't they lowered his attack speed buy 15%ish and his total damage output by about 10-20%. But the removed his the armor/mr Shred of his AoE attacks and only works for his melee attacks. So now if 0/4/5 support {{champion:61}} shows up they can't hit a 3 man shockwave and one shot the opposing team that's ahead 20 kills/5 towers and the boards think this is awful because reasons.

I don't understand riot sometimes.

Baron is for taking when you ACE the enemy team. If you try to sneak baron when the enemy team is up you SHOULD be punished if you are caught.

Now the winning team can just 5 man baron and turn on whoever comes easy.
Baron was fine before nerf tbh. Don't understand why this balance team always has to go overboard when changing something.

Seems like it does less damage than before they buffed it. It really does no damage it's funny.
